intro: Mentzelia tweedyi, commonly known as Tweedy's blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy yellow to orange flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation. Mentzelia tweedyi is often found in arid environments and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
